etymology.interpretation: Combines “flower” with “bundle” to denote a bunch of flowers tied together; emphasizes an arranged, bound grouping rather than loose flowers.

parts.english: bundle; to tie/bind; measure word for bunches/beams; to restrain/limit

examples.chinese: 他捧着花束走进教室(他捧著花束走進教室)。
examples.pinyin: Tā pěngzhe huāshù zǒu jìn jiàoshì.
examples.english: He walked into the classroom holding a bouquet.

examples.chinese: 新娘手里的花束很精致(新娘手裡的花束很精緻)。
examples.pinyin: Xīnniáng shǒu lǐ de huāshù hěn jīngzhì.

examples.chinese: 我们用丝带把花束扎好(我們用絲帶把花束紮好)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yòng sīdài bǎ huāshù zhā hǎo.
examples.english: We tied the bouquet with a ribbon.
